name: Supplier-Optimization-Sample
parameters: --var execute=true --var selectProject=1881406,2178639,2224852,2303556,2330101,2338665,2364896 --var workflow_18_leadweek=2 --var workflow_18_deliveryweek=-1 --var workflow_18_minmaxlevel=Project --var workflow_18_bundlesize=42 --var workflow_18_solverchoice=HiGHS --var workflow_18_gaprel=0.001 --var workflow_18_runningtime=180 --var dataGrid=projects:supply:min:max**'2261096':'JR New Energy Inc. - TX - Fort worth':0:100

nodes.name: Read CSV
nodes.description: It reads in CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it.
nodes.hint: Refresh the schema when a new file is selected or the file content has changed

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Path of the file/directory

fields.name: separator
fields.title: Separator
fields.description: CSV Separator

fields.name: header
fields.title: Header
fields.description: Whether the file has a header row

fields.name: dropSpecialCharacterInColumnName
fields.title: Drop Special Character In ColumnName
fields.description: Whether to drop the Special Characters and Spaces in Column Name.

fields.name: mode
fields.title: Mode
fields.description: Mode for dealing with corrupt records during parsing.

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

fields.name: addInputFileName
fields.title: Whether to Add Input File Name as Column in the Dataframe
fields.description: Add the new field:input_file_name

fields.name: encoding
fields.title: Encoding
fields.description: Decodes the CSV files by the given encoding type

fields.name: quote
fields.title: Quote
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value

fields.name: escape
fields.title: Escape
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value.

fields.title: Column Names for the CSV
fields.description: New Columns from CSV

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Column Types for the CSV
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColFormats
fields.title: Column Formats for the CSV
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

fields.title: Properties Name
fields.description: Extra options/properites available while executing in Read CSV.

fields.name: lead_week
fields.title: Lead Week
fields.description: Weeks before project start for allowing delivery.

fields.name: DeliveryWeek
fields.title: Delivery Week
fields.description: If -1, deliver by endWeek. Else, deliver by startWeek + DeliveryWeek.

fields.name: MinMaxLevel
fields.title: MinMax Level
fields.description: Project (apply Min/Max PCT at project level) or Product (per product).

fields.name: bundle_size
fields.title: Bundle Size
fields.description: Fixed units per bundle.

fields.name: solver_choice
fields.title: Solver Choice
fields.description: Solver name: HiGHS or CBC

fields.name: gap_rel
fields.title: Gap Rel
fields.description: Relative optimality gap for solver.

fields.name: running_time
fields.title: Running Time
fields.description: Solver timeout in seconds.

nodes.name: Filter by user input

nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to Schema tab and Refresh the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value: select * FROM fire_temp_table where Project in (${selectProject})
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

fields.name: outputColNames
fields.title: Output Column Names
fields.description: Name of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Output Column Types
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColFormats
fields.title: Output Column Formats
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

nodes.name: Filter by user input
nodes.description: This node registers the incoming DataFrames as temporary tables and executes the SQL provided

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTables
fields.title: Temp Table Names
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value: select aa.* from tempTable1 aa join tempTable2 bb on aa.Project = bb.Project
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

fields.name: outputColNames
fields.title: Column Names for the CSV
fields.description: New Output Columns of the SQL

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Column Types for the CSV
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColFormats
fields.title: Column Formats for the CSV
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

nodes.name: Filter by user input
nodes.description: This node registers the incoming DataFrames as temporary tables and executes the SQL provided

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTables
fields.title: Temp Table Names
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
select aa.* from tempTable1 aa join 
(
    select DISTINCT Product from tempTable2 bb
) cc on aa.Product = cc.Product
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

fields.name: outputColNames
fields.title: Column Names for the CSV
fields.description: New Output Columns of the SQL

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Column Types for the CSV
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColFormats
fields.title: Column Formats for the CSV
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

fields.name: storageLevel

fields.name: tempTables
fields.title: Temp Table Names
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
select a1.* from tempTable1 a1 join 
(
    select DISTINCT Product from tempTable2 a2
) a3 on a1.Product = a3.Product

fields.name: code
fields.value:
'''
Input:
  spark: spark session 
  workflowContext:  workflowcontext object 
  id: node number 
  inDF: input pyspark dataframe 
  cust_dict: Dictionary of the workflow variables passed from previous node 
Output:
  outDF: return pyspark dataframe i.e outDF 
 ''' 
 
from pyspark.sql.types import * 
from pyspark.sql.functions import * 
from pyspark.sql import * 
from fire.workflowcontext import WorkflowContext
import pandas as pd

def myfn(spark: SparkSession, workflowContext: WorkflowContext, id: int, inDF: DataFrame, cust_dict:dict):
  data = "${dataGrid}" # "projects:'001'|supply:'s01'|min:2|max:10,projects:'002'|supply:'s01'|min:4|max:20" # "${dataGrid}"
  print(data, "data")
  workflowContext.outStr(id, data, "data")
  # Split input into rows
  try:
    rows = data.strip().split("**")
    # Extract header and data
    header = rows[0].split(":")
    data_rows = [r.split(":") for r in rows[1:]]
    # Define schema manually (as per your instruction)
    schema = StructType([StructField("projects", StringType(), True),StructField("supply", StringType(), True),StructField("min", IntegerType(), True),StructField("max", IntegerType(), True)])
    # Convert data to proper types
    data_converted = [(r[0], r[1], int(r[2]), int(r[3])) for r in data_rows]
    outDF = spark.createDataFrame(data_converted, schema=schema)
  except Exception as e:
    schema = StructType([StructField("projects", StringType(), True),StructField("supply", StringType(), True),StructField("min", IntegerType(), True),StructField("max", IntegerType(), True)])
    outDF = spark.createDataFrame([], schema)
  return outDF

fields.description: PySpark code to be run. Input dataframe : "inDF", SparkContext : "sc", SQLContext : "sqlContext",  Output/Result dataframe should be registered as a temporary table - df.registerTempTable("outDF")

fields.value:

projects as Project,
supply as Supplier,
`min` as MinPCT,
`max` as MaxPCT 
from fire_temp_table

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT aa.Project,
aa.Supplier, 
aa.RatePerMile,
aa.Distance,
coalesce(bb.MinPCT, aa.MinPCT) as MinPCT,
coalesce(bb.MaxPCT, aa.MaxPCT) as MaxPCT
FROM tempTable1 aa LEFT JOIN tempTable2 bb 
ON aa.Project = bb.Project AND 
aa.Supplier = bb.Supplier
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run
